name: Einstein Field Equations (General Relativity)
explanation: Einstein's 1915 field equations describe how matter and energy curve spacetime, producing gravity. G_μν is the Einstein tensor (describing spacetime curvature), Λ is the cosmological constant, g_μν is the metric tensor, and T_μν is the stress-energy tensor (describing matter/energy). These equations revolutionized our understanding of gravity, predicting black holes, gravitational waves, and the expansion of the universe. They've been confirmed by observations of light bending, time dilation, and gravitational waves.

examples.problem: What phenomena did Einstein's field equations predict?
examples.solution: Black holes, gravitational waves, time dilation, light bending, expanding universe
steps: Black holes: Solutions where spacetime curvature becomes infinite
Gravitational waves: Ripples in spacetime (detected in 2015)
Time dilation: Time runs slower in stronger gravitational fields
Light bending: Light follows curved paths near massive objects
Expanding universe: Solutions show space itself can expand

proof: Einstein derived these by requiring that the laws of physics be the same in all reference frames (general covariance) and that they reduce to Newton's gravity in weak fields. The left side describes geometry (spacetime curvature), the right side describes matter/energy.
